section.title: Create your first project
section.para: Now independent of the container you picked up, you can use all the extensions and tools that the framework provides. Also your test will run the same in both containers.

important.para: In order to import the project to Eclipse, you need first to create the required files for Eclipse. To do this change to the project's directory and issue the following command:

section.para:
Next open up Eclipse and import your project. Now you can run the tests by running src/test/java/SimpleSipServletTest.java with "Run As -> JUnit Test" or from the command shell using Maven Surefire plugin with this command:
mvn test
No matter which way you chose to run the test, you will see a lot of messages in your console and at the the end the GREEN bar, meaning that your test passes.
Next chapter will provide some details about the test project and the needed configuration.
